articleContent.title: Chord: Major 7th in D (Shape: D)
articleContent.content:
# Chord: Major 7th in D (Shape: D)

## Brief Description
The Major 7th chord in D, played with the D shape, consists of the notes D-F#-A-C#. It is a rich and vibrant chord that adds a sense of sophistication and jazzy flavor to music.

## Notes and Intervals
- D: Root
- F#: Major 3rd
- A: Perfect 5th
- C#: Major 7th

## Genre and Musical Flavor
The Major 7th chord in D is often used in jazz, soul, and R&B music. It has a smooth and dreamy sound that adds a sense of warmth and color to compositions. This chord is often used to create a mellow and sophisticated atmosphere in music.

## Songs
Here are three songs that feature the Major 7th chord in D:
1. "Fly Me to the Moon" by Frank Sinatra
2. "Don't Know Why" by Norah Jones
3. "Isn't She Lovely" by Stevie Wonder
